dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, you are NOT going to believe what I just read!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, you are N O T going to believe what I just read!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, there's this dude, right, Ruslan Abdikalikov, like, the Chairman of Information Security, and he's got the simplest, most crucial data protection tip.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, there's this dude, right, Ruslan Abdikalikov, like, the Chairman of Information Security, and he's got the simplest, most crucial data protection tip.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ruslan Abdikalikov, Chairman of the Committee for Information Security of the Ministry of Digital Development, Innovations, and Aerospace Industry, has named the simplest and most crucial method for safeguarding personal data.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! I saw that! It's so obvious, but like, people still fall for it!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! I saw that! It's so obvious, but like, people still fall for it!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, for real! He's talking about that 1414 code. You know, the one they send?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, for real! He's talking about that fourteen fourteen code. You know, the one they send?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We would like to once again remind our citizens of the most basic things: never share the code sent from 1414 with anyone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: YES! The message itself, like, it literally says in three languages, "DO NOT SHARE THIS CODE."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Y E S! The message itself, like, it literally says in three languages, D O N O T S H A R E T H I S C O D E.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If you look closely at this message, you™ll see that it is already written in three languages—Russian, Kazakh, and English—that you should not share the code with anyone.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right?! It's like, they're spelling it out for you! And still, people give it away!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right?! It's like, they're spelling it out for you! And still, people give it away!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild! But then, um, he also mentioned, like, the other important stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild! But then, um, he also mentioned, like, the other important stuff.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah! Software updates! Keep your devices, uh, like, everything updated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah! Software updates! Keep your devices, uh, like, everything updated.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Additionally, the committee chairman emphasized the importance of regularly updating software on computers, personal devices, and mobile phones.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Phones, computers, all of it! It's, like, basic hygiene for your tech.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Phones, computers, all of it! It's, like, basic hygiene for your tech.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And, uh, suspicious messages. Don't respond, don't click links from strangers!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, uh, suspicious messages. Don't respond, don't click links from strangers!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is also not advisable to respond to suspicious messages or click on links sent by strangers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: YES! Especially those, like, "Our girl is in a contest, vote for her!" ones.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Y E S! Especially those, like, Our girl is in a contest, vote for her! ones.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: One of the most common types of fraud involves messages like: 'Our girl is participating in a contest, please vote—every vote matters.'

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Ugh, those are the worst! There's no girl, there's no contest!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ugh, those are the worst! There's no girl, there's no contest!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In most cases, there is no contest or girl behind these messages, only scammers using phishing sites to steal personal data—or worse, banking details.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! It's just, like, scammers trying to get your banking details, or your personal data.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! It's just, like, scammers trying to get your banking details, or your personal data.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...only scammers using phishing sites to steal personal data—or worse, banking details.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: They're basically trying to steal your money!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're basically trying to steal your money!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a result, you could lose your money,

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Or worse, um, your whole identity! And then the National Bank also warned about fake bank employee messages, remember?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or worse, um, your whole identity! And then the National Bank also warned about fake bank employee messages, remember?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Previously, the National Bank of Kazakhstan issued a warning about fraudulent messages being sent under the guise of bank employees.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yes! That was a huge one too! So many people, like, almost lost everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yes! That was a huge one too! So many people, like, almost lost everything.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's just, um, common sense, really.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just, um, common sense, really.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But, like, apparently not common enough!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But, like, apparently not common enough!
